title: The big AI players won't get tax breaks, says Andrew Charlton | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: More innovation is needed onshore if Australia is to share in the dividends from the rapid rollout of artificial intelligence - that's the message from the Assistant Technology and Digital Economy Minister Andrew Charlton.  Dr Charlton joined The Business following a speech to the Australian Business Economics Conference, where he warned inaction risks an "uberisation" of the economy, where AI's profits are exported. He told Kirsten Aiken there needs to be a balance between what big AI companies coming into Australia want, and what Australia wants from them.  He confirmed the government is not contemplating tax breaks for AI companies, and will not weaken copyright laws. #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Passport changes in force for British and Irish dual nationals | ABC NEWS
description: There's been a last-minute scramble for passports on the eve of new UK border rules with changes to required travel documents. Under the new rules, British and Irish nationals must carry a British or Irish passport to enter the UK, or a certificate of entitlement in their Australian passport. The controversial changes have caused confusion and grief for impacted dual nationals. title: 4-year anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine | ABC NEWS
description: It's been four years since Russia launched its large-scale invasion into Ukraine.  In the years since, Russia has struggled to record major territorial gains, and Ukraine has been unable to fully repel its invaders.  So, is there an end in sight for the conflict? title: Parents release emotional statement in Gus Lamont case | ABC NEWS
description: The parents of four-year-old Gus Lamont have broken their silence five months after he went missing. They've released vision and a photo of their son who disappeared in South Australia's north last September, alongside a heartfelt appeal to the public for anyone with information to come forward. title: Police believe human remains belong to kidnapped man Chris Baghsarian | ABC NEWS
description: Police have found human remains near a golf club in Pitt Town they suspect belong to kidnapped Sydney grandfather Chris Baghsarian. The 85-year-old was abducted from his North Ryde home in what police believed to be a case of mistaken identity.  Police have been probing the incident's potential links to organised crime. title: Royal commission into antisemitism, Bondi Beach terror attack begins | ABC NEWS
description: The federal royal commission that was called in the wake of the Bondi terror attack has begun in Sydney. The commission was announced six weeks ago after sustained pressure on the government. It's been revealed the commission will not hear evidence from key witnesses of the massacre to avoid prejudicing a criminal trial. title: Life in Ukraine four years on from Russia's invasion | ABC NEWS
description: The war in Ukraine has entered its fifth year with no end in sight, despite negotiation efforts toward a peace deal. An estimated 1.2 million Russian troops and close to 600,000 Ukrainian troops have been killed or wounded, while more than 15,000 Ukrainian civilians have also been killed, according to the United Nations. Russian missile strikes and power blackouts have been a regular occurance for Ukrainian civilians caught in the conflict. title: Developer behind Gold Coast's Trump Tower has been bankrupt twice | ABC NEWS
description: Insolvency records show the Gold Coast developer trying to get a $1.5 billion Trump hotel and tower project built in Surfers Paradise has faced financial difficulties in previous businesses. David Young of Altus Property Group this week stunned the Australian property scene by revealing he had signed a deal with the Trump Organization for a 340-metre tall, six-star luxury complex in the heart of Surfers Paradise.  A search by the ABC of federal insolvency records revealed the 60-year-old has also had personal financial scrapes.  #ABCNewsQld by Will Murray  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2026-02-24/trump-tower-developer-went-bankrupt-twice/106379446  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Vic. govt refers surgeon Simon Gordon allegations to police | ABC NEWS
description: The Victorian government has referred explosive allegations made about a renowned Melbourne gynaecologist to police after Four Corners uncovered the experiences of multiple women. Doctor Simon Gordon is alleged to have carried out surgeries for severe endometriosis when pathology showed little or no trace of the condition. Premier Jacinta Allan is calling for justice for the affected women. title: WIN television network announces acquisition of Nine News Darwin | ABC NEWS
description: Regional news broadcaster WIN has announced a half-a-million-dollar acquisition of Nine News Darwin.  In early 2025, Nine axed its local half-hour news program, replacing it with Queensland news, prompting concern and outrage from local audiences.  The announcement again raises questions about the future of commercial regional news. Olivana Lathouris has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Wet weather concerns ease in central Australia, flood watches continue for region | ABC NEWS
description: Wild weather is finally starting to ease across Central Australia, as a tropical low slowly moves south.  While roads in flood-affected areas are starting to re-open, including the main freight route to Darwin, there are evacuated people in the Barkly that are tonight still waiting to return home. Courtney Barrett-Peters reports for ABC News Northern Territory.   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Political fallout continues in France after killing of far-right activist | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The death of a young far-right activist in France has sparked outrage and protests across the country. Quentin Daranque was allegedly beaten by a group of masked men, reported to be members of a far-left movement. The incident has drawn condemnation from across the political spectrum as France grapples with rising division ahead of a March election. Former French government advisor Natanael Bloch shares his analysis with The World's Yvonne Yong. title: Death of cartel kingpin to "reconfigure" the landscape of violence in Mexico | The World | ABC NEWS
description: More than 70 people are dead after violence broke out on the streets of Mexico in response to the killing of cartel leader El Mencho by the Mexican military. Both the Mexican and US governments had been tracking the drug kingpin for years with multiple warrants out for his arrest. Schools have been forced to close and people are being warned to stay inside as violent stand-offs between the Mexican national guard and cartel members rock the country. Dr. Irene Mia from the International Institute for Strategic Studies tells The World El Mencho was controlling the "most powerful organised crime group in Mexico and arguably in Latin America."
